problem_text:
Problem 34. Suppose that A ⊂ [N] is a set of size ⩾ c√N for which rA(n) ⩽ r
for all n. What can be said about the structure of A?
Comments. Whilst all known constructions are at least somewhat algebraic, even
formulating a conjecture (even in the case c ≈ 1 and r = 1) seems hopeless. See
